Extract link and inverse link functions from models

Source: R/family-utils.R
link.Rd

Returns the link or its inverse from an estimated model, and provides a simple way to extract these functions from complex models with multiple links, such as location scale models.

link(object, ...)

# S3 method for family
link(
  object,
  parameter = c("location", "scale", "shape"),
  which_eta = NULL,
  ...
)

# S3 method for gam
link(object, parameter = c("location", "scale", "shape"), ...)

# S3 method for bam
link(object, parameter = c("location", "scale", "shape"), ...)

# S3 method for gamm
link(object, ...)

# S3 method for glm
link(object, ...)

# S3 method for list
link(object, ...)

inv_link(object, ...)

# S3 method for family
inv_link(
  object,
  parameter = c("location", "scale", "shape"),
  which_eta = NULL,
  ...
)

# S3 method for gam
inv_link(object, parameter = c("location", "scale", "shape"), ...)

# S3 method for bam
inv_link(object, parameter = c("location", "scale", "shape"), ...)

# S3 method for gamm
inv_link(object, ...)

# S3 method for list
inv_link(object, ...)

# S3 method for glm
inv_link(object, ...)

Arguments

object

a family object or a fitted model from which to extract the family object. Models fitted by stats::glm(), mgcv::gam(), mgcv::bam(), mgcv::gamm(), and gamm4::gamm4() are currently supported.
...

arguments passed to other methods.
parameter

character; which parameter of the distribution. Usually "location" but "scale" and "shape" may be provided for location scale models. Other options include "mu" and "sigma" as synonyms for "location" and "scale" respectively, "pi" for the zero-inflation term in mgcv::ziplss(), "power" for the mgcv::twlss() power parameter, and "xi", the shape parameter for mgcv::gevlss().
which_eta

numeric; the linear predictor to extract for families mgcv::mvn() and mgcv::multinom().

Author

Gavin L. Simpson

Examples

load_mgcv()

link(gaussian())

#> function (mu) 
#> mu
#> <environment: namespace:stats>
link(nb())

#> function (mu) 
#> log(mu)
#> <environment: namespace:stats>

inv_link(nb())

#> function (eta) 
#> pmax(exp(eta), .Machine$double.eps)
#> <environment: namespace:stats>

# \dontshow{
set.seed(4234)
# }
dat <- gamSim(1, n = 400, dist = "normal", scale = 2, verbose = FALSE)
mod <- gam(list(y ~ s(x0) + s(x1) + s(x2) + s(x3), ~ 1), data = dat,
           family = gaulss)

link(mod, parameter = "scale")

#> function (mu) 
#> log(1/mu - 0.01)
#> <environment: 0x7fdcafdcd8a8>
inv_link(mod, parameter = "scale")

#> function (eta) 
#> 1/(exp(eta) + 0.01)
#> <environment: 0x7fdcafdcd8a8>
